intro: Braya tibetica f. sinuata, commonly known as the Sinuous Drummond's Sandwort, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers and its distinctive, lobed leaves. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
